snippet: Sid Miller, the state’s new agriculture commissioner, says government mandates have failed to make children healthier in Texas, where roughly two-thirds of residents are considered overweight or obese.
abstract: Texas Agriculture Commissioner Sid Miller announces end to decade-old ban on deep fried foods in public schools; move is considered unwelcome reversal by health advocates and school nutritionists.
lead_paragraph: Sid Miller, the state’s new agriculture commissioner, says government mandates have failed to make children healthier in Texas, where roughly two-thirds of residents are considered overweight or obese.

headline.main: Texas: Deep Fryers, Once Banned by State, Are Allowed to Return to Public Schools
headline.print_headline: Texas: State to End Ban on Deep Fryers in Schools
